title: Ticket #7599: Assertion error w/ ft plugin with multiple output remaps in CHTC
description:
executable = /usr/bin/touch
transfer_executable = false
arguments = file1 file2

transfer_plugins = dummy=dummy_plugin.py
transfer_output_remaps = "file1 = dummy://path/to/file1; file2 = dummy://path/to/file2"

log = log

request_memory = 1GB
request_disk = 1GB

queue 1

dummy_plugin.py: https://gist.github.com/jasoncpatton/6a32e3af7ef97c61b783a3e542b7a52e

Submitting this from submit2.chtc.wisc.edu results in log (more often than not): 

000 (6028850.000.000) 2020-04-15 10:27:53 Job submitted from host: <128.104.101.92:9618?addrs=128.104.101.92-9618+[2607-f388-107c-501-a236-9fff-fe3c-caa8]-9618&alias=submit2.chtc.wisc.edu&noUDP&sock=schedd_3841921_d3c3>
...

	Transferring to host: <128.105.245.44:9618?addrs=128.105.245.44-9618&alias=e3244.chtc.wisc.edu&noUDP&sock=slot1_3_12598_2e39_46129>
...

...
001 (6028850.000.000) 2020-04-15 10:28:18 Job executing on host: <128.105.245.44:9618?addrs=128.105.245.44-9618&alias=e3244.chtc.wisc.edu&noUDP&sock=startd_4238_7e75>
...

040 (6028850.000.000) 2020-04-15 10:28:21 Finished transferring output files

007 (6028850.000.000) 2020-04-15 10:28:21 Shadow exception!
	Error from slot1_3@e3244.chtc.wisc.edu: Assertion ERROR on (m_ft_info.hold_code != 0)
	0  -  Run Bytes Sent By Job
	5384  -  Run Bytes Received By Job
...

Given long enough, this job will complete successfully, but may take a few cycles of running on a new slot and the assertion error happening after file output. I have seen jobs complete successfully on the same slot that they previously failed.

Have not been able to reproduce in a personal condor running 8.9.6. This bug may require multiple nodes to reproduce.
check_ins: 2020-Apr-16 21:34   Check-in [59375]: fix bug in file_transfer that incorrectly incremented a pointer instead of what it pointed to. #7599 (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
